description: In this module, you will gain an understanding of what, exactly, color management is.
body: In this module, you will gain an understanding of what, exactly, color management is.
title: Module 1 - Color Management Defined

description: In this module you will gain an understanding of the meaning of color space, and gamut, and by the end, you will be able to explain one of the key concepts of color management, L*a*b* color space.
body: In this module you will gain an understanding of the meaning of color space, and gamut, and by the end, you will be able to explain one of the key concepts of color management, L*a*b* color space.
title: Module 2 - Color Space and Gamut

description: When you are finished with this module, you will be able to explain how we define color accuracy, and explain how color accuracy is quantified through the use of Delta-E.
body: When you are finished with this module, you will be able to explain how we define color accuracy, and explain how color accuracy is quantified through the use of Delta-E. I will also use the Adobe Photoshop interface, full screen, with voice-over only.
title: Module 3 - Color Accuracy and Delta-E

displayTitle: Module 4 - Device Dependent and Device Independent Color
description: In this module, you will explore the concepts of device dependent and independent color and how L*a*b* color space fits into the equation.
body: In this module, you will explore the concepts of device dependent and independent color and how L*a*b* color space fits into the equation.
title: Module 4 - Device Dependent and Device Independent Color

displayTitle: Module 5 - Rendering Intents and Black Point Compensation
description: When you have completed this module, you will be able to explain what rendering intents and black point compensation and to select the appropriate options.
body: When you have completed this module, you will not only be able to explain what rendering intents and black point compensation are, but you will be able to select the appropriate options whenever you need to correctly select the options in your software applications.
title: Module 5 - Rendering Intents and Black Point Compensation

description: In this module, you will learn why color needs to be transformed from one color space to another and how this process can differ between a proofing workflow and a production workflow.
body: In this module, you will learn why color needs to be transformed from one color space to another and how this process can differ between a proofing workflow and a production workflow. I will also use the Adobe Photoshop interface, full screen, with voice-over only.
title: Module 6 - Color Transforms

description: When you finish this module, you will be able to explain the difference between calibration and profiling, and also explain how each activity impacts color reproduction.
body: When you finish this module, you will be able to explain the difference between calibration and profiling, and also explain how each activity impacts color reproduction.
title: Module 7 - Calibration and Profiling

description: When you finish this module, you will be able to select proper settings for common black generation options as well as explain the concept of GCR.
body: When you finish this module, you will be able to select proper settings for common black generation options as well as explain the concept of GCR.
title: Module 8 - Black Generation and GCR

description: In this module, you will learn why spot colors are the most difficult graphic arts element to reproduce accurately.
body: In this module you will learn why spot colors are the most difficult graphic arts element to reproduce accurately.
title: Module 9 - Spot Colors

description: In this module, you will explore the differences between Standards and Specifications along with their value and limitations. You will also gain an understanding of and limitations of the important file types used in the graphic arts industry.
body: In this module you will explore the differences between Standards and Specifications along with their value and limitations. You will also gain an understanding of and limitations of the important file types used in the graphic arts industry.
title: Module 10 - Standards and Specification

description: When you complete this module, you will be able to properly select the correct illuminant setting on your spectrophotometer, and explain the importance of proper viewing conditions.
body: When you complete this module, you will be able to properly select the correct illuminant setting on your spectrophotometer, and explain the importance of proper viewing conditions.
title: Module 11 - Measurement Methods and Viewing Conditions

body:
Congratulations! 


You now have all of the fundamental knowledge needed for a firm understanding of the foundational concepts of color management. This brief course did more than scratch the surface of this extensive topic, and it is recommended that you continue your education by completing additional Fiery courses, review documents available at help.efi.com, and read up on the subject by browsing through books on the topic from your local library or available from sites such as amazon.com. And, be sure to practice what you learn. No amount of reading can replace hands-on experience in this powerful field of study.
title: SUMMARY
